content:
本件保存
會員委設建 庫 水 門石 SHIHMEN DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION
SDC - 5181
May 22, 1962
Mr. K. T. Li, Secretary General Council for United States Aid 118 Hwaining Street Taipei, Taiwan
Subject:
GSA Surplus Equipment
Dear Mr. Li:
Please refer to the attached copy of Mr. G. C. Johnson's letter MK-1508 dated May 21, 1962 and the catalogue attached thereto concerning the subject matter.
It is recommended by MKA that the equipment as shown in Mr. Johnson's letter are required by the Shihmen project. We, there- fore, request your immediate arrangement with AID/C to locate these equipment for Shihmen project.
Your earliest action to the above will be highly appreciated.
2
51.5. 24 1028- V.O.
8 G.
2
C: USA
Very truly yours,
SHIHMEN DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION
6. 11.1Km W. K. Ku Chief Engineer
Enclosures up $1
cc: Mr. J. B. Carter, AID/C (w/encl. ) Mr. G. C. Johnson, MKA
of 5/15
84/10
Catalog Mr. Carter B
安 Mr. Potter et
A 史饭 Jeademia Historica
327
年

It is recommended by MKA that the equipment as shown in

fore, request your immediate arrangement with AID/C to locate these
Your earliest action to the above will be highly appreciated.

Mr. K. T. Li, Secretary General Council for United States Aid 118 Hwaining Street Taipei, Taiwan
Please refer to the attached copy of Mr. G. C. Johnson's letter MK-1508 dated May 21, 1962 and the catalogue attached thereto concerning the subject matter.

It is recommended by MKA that the equipment as shown in Mr. Johnson's letter are required by the Shihmen project. We, there- fore, request your immediate arrangement with AID/C to locate these equipment for Shihmen project.
Your earliest action to the above will be highly appreciated.
